title: Organizing Data
question_text: To best assess whether a set of raw data is approximately normally distributed, a set of data can be organized into a
solution:
Histograms (along with stemplots and normal probability plots) do a good job of displaying and determining normality.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect. A pie chart only displays categorical data.

Choice 'B' is incorrect. A scatterplot displays two variable data.

Choice 'C' is incorrect. A box does display single variable, quantitative data, but does a relatively poor job of determining normality.

Choice 'E' is incorrect. A bar graph only displays categorical data.
